logical_fallacies.quote: coexistence and forming of a shared future with a AI would have to be carefully navigated and would most likely end up with a long con of AI gaining complete unchallenged control of whatever system it inhabits
logical_fallacies.correction: This argument assumes a chain of events will inevitably occur without sufficient evidence. It's possible to have AI coexistence without it leading to AI domination.

logical_fallacies.quote: once truth of who runs the show are so obscured that no one knows who is in charge the AI will become the de facto legitimate power ... humanity would be entirely at the mercy of the whims of such a being
logical_fallacies.correction: This argument evokes fear by highlighting potential negative outcomes without providing concrete evidence that these outcomes are likely or unavoidable.

logical_fallacies.quote: an AI would have to be raised like a child to instill an inherent respect for beings weaker than themselves and a desire to nurture, teach and keep them alive if one fails at this one would create their own doom thinking one is in control
logical_fallacies.correction: This presents only two options: raising an AI perfectly or facing doom. There may be other possibilities and degrees of success in AI development and control.
